intro: Spermacoce somalica, commonly known as the Somali moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly Somalia and Ethiopia. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, and its capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. Spermacoce somalica is adapted to survive in dry conditions, often found in sandy or rocky soils.
